data.title: Every Zombie Movie Ever Made
data.meta_description: Action Flick Chick Twitter By special request, here’s every zombie movie ever made – in chronological order. Fast zombies, slow zombies, fat zombies, skinny zombies, even zombies with all kinds of …
data.text:
Action Flick Chick Twitter

By special request, here’s every zombie movie ever made – in chronological order. Fast zombies, slow zombies, fat zombies, skinny zombies, even zombies with all kinds of pox…

Don’t yell at us about some of these entries. People fought this list out (not arranged in this order, though) on Wikipedia. Argue with them about I Am Legend…and 28 Days Later…and on and on and on. Why aren’t Idle Hands and House 2 on this list? Maybe oversight. Or maybe not every motion picture with a zombie in it counts as a zombie movie the same way that not every film with a cowboy counts as a cowboy movie.

Despite the hyperbole of the title, it’s just not every zombie movie ever made. For instance, indie films generally got left out, probably due to a perception of insufficient notability. There’s no Siege of the Dead (good movie) or Vampires Vs. Zombies (bad), although it does have Corpses Are Forever, a film worthy of Ed Wood himself. Short films, television series or episodes, and nonfiction documentaries are excluded altogether.

We are going to weed out some items that are just plain wrong. If there’s any room for argument (hello again I Am Legend), it stays. Period. This isn’t the place to hash that out. So, keeping that in mind, please point out any that are inarguably incorrect.

Thanks go out to Batty from http://www.shadowbat.com and Paul Metcalf of http://www.pzomb.com for raising questions which inspired this.

White Zombie Victor Halperin 1932 Chalta Purza Balwant Bhatt 1932 Ouanga George Terwilliger 1936 Revolt of the Zombies Victor Halperin 1936 The Ghost Breakers George Marshall 1940 King of the Zombies Jean Yarbrough 1941 I Walked with a Zombie Jacques Tourneur 1943 Revenge of the Zombies Steve Sekely 1943 Zombies on Broadway Gordon Dines & Gordon M. Douglas 1945 Zombies of the Stratosphere Fred C. Brannon 1952 Bury me Dead Charles Marquis Warren 1957 Zombies of Mora Tau Edward L. Cahn 1957 Plan 9 from Outer Space Edward D. Wood, Jr. 1959 Teenage Zombies Jerry Warren 1959 Zombie in a Haunted House Evan Yang 1959 The Dead One Barry Mahon 1961 Invasion of the Zombies Benito Alazraki 1962 Santo Contra los Zombis Benito Alazraki 1962 Castle of the Living Dead Luciano Ricci / Lorenzo Sabatini / Michael Reeves 1964 The Horror of Party Beach Del Tenney 1964 I Eat Your Skin Del Tenney 1964 The Incredibly Strange Creatures Who Stopped Living and Became Mixed-Up Zombies Ray Dennis Steckler 1964 The Last Man on Earth Ubaldo Ragona/Sidney Salkow 1964 Zombies Del Tenney 1964 Cemetery of the Living Dead Massimo Pupillo 1965 Terror-Creatures from the Grave Massimo Pupillo 1965 The Plague of the Zombies John Gilling 1966 Mad Doctor of Blood Island Eddie Romero / Gerardo de León 1968

And then George Romero and company redefined zombies forever after…

Romero 2011 Pride and Prejudice and Zombies 2011 Virulents John Moore 2011

Take these future films with a grain of salt. Almost every item on this list is linked to a source, so check out those sources to evaluate them for yourselves. Some of those 2010 and 2011 films include items that are simply “in development,” some of which have dwelled for years down in development hell – like George Romero’s Diamond Dead.

This is the Action Flick Chick, and you’ve just been kicked in the ass!
